title: Odisha govt to set up new 300 bed COVID-19 hospital at VIMSAR
description: Sambalpur, Apr 14 (PTI) Following rise in the number of coronavirus cases in western region of the state, Odisha government has decided to set up a new COVID hospital with 300-beds including 50 ICU beds at Veer Surendra Sai Institute of Medical Sciences and Research (VIMSAR), Burla.

title: Punjab reports 3,329 new COVID19 cases, 3,173 recoveries and 63 deaths

description: Seven servitors and three of their family members, 8 workers engaged at the shoe-stand at the main gate of the temple, a security personnel of Jagannath Temple Police, and a gardener were among those who tested positive

title: People Entering Odisha Without Covid Negative Report, Vaccination Certificate To Self-Quarantine
description: People travelling to Odisha without a negative RT-PCR report or vaccination certificate are being asked to go under self-quarantine by the authorities, in an effort to maintain the crowd amid the COVID-19 pandemic surge.

description: Bhubaneswar: As many as three more persons died of COVID-19 in Odisha during the last 24 hours taking the toll to 1,933, official sources said today. All of them died while undergoing treatment in hospitals. The deceased have been identified as a 43-year-old man of Bolangir district who was also suffering from Diabetes Mellitus, a […]

title: Odisha: Coronavirus grows faster, 1784 new cases
description: Meanwhile, the State government has issued an SOP for shifting of critical Covid patients to cluster-level hospitals having better facilities and avoid overcrowding of patients.

title: Covid-19: 11 of 30 Odisha districts run out of vaccines
description: The 11 districts – Bhadrak, Boudh, Dhenkanal, Gajapati, Jajpur, Jharsuguda, Koraput, Nayagarh, Puri, Sambalpur and Sonepur – have run out of Covid-19 vaccines. No vaccination against Covid-19 was carried out in these districts on Tuesday.

title: Odisha govt issues guidelines for COVID-19 preparations to hospitals
description: In view of the spike in COVID-19 cases in Odisha, the health and family welfare department of the state government on Tuesday had asked all districts administrations to activate all government and private COVID-19 hospitals and medical facilities

title: Odisha halts Covid-19 inoculation in 11 districts due to shortage of vaccines
description: Odisha Health Minister NK Das had on Monday written a letter to Union Health Minister Dr Harsh Vardhan urging to supply at least 10 days stock of Covishield (25 lakh doses).

title: Covid-19 Second Wave: Bhubaneswar In Odisha Saw Cases Up 558% In April |OTV News
description: The State capital is witnessing an explosive rise in new Covid-19 cases since the beginning of April. The number of new cases has grown by a massive 558 per cent to 191 today vis-a-vis of only 29 on March 31, though the last 7-days rolling average give some hope to recoup.

title: Covid-19 In Odisha: 3 Children Getting Infected Every Hour; Check Symptoms |OTV News
description: Here is an emergency Covid-19 alert for the parents in Odisha. Echoing the national trend, in the last 72-hours, a high of 233 children in the age group of 0-14 years have been infected in the second wave. In the last 24-hrs, 82 of the total 1784 new positives are below 14-years.

title: Odisha's COVID-19 tally breaches 3.5-lakh mark with 1,741 new cases
description: Odisha now has 9,259 active cases, while 3,40,062 people have recovered from the disease so far. Fifty-three patients have died due to comorbidities so far.

title: Odisha cinema halls sealed for flouting COVID-19 norms
description: The state is now witnessing a surge in COVID-19 cases which has forced the authorities to take stringent actions to curb the spread of the disease. The state government increased the penalty amount to Rs 2,000 for the first and second offence for people not wearing masks.

title: Covid-19: Fresh infections crossed 1300 in Odisha, many wait for vaccination | TOI Original - Times of India Videos
description: As the second wave of Covid-19 grew rapidly in Odisha, more and more people came out to take vaccination in the state capital. Many people were seen waiting in queues outside vaccination centres in Bhubaneswar. Over 1300 fresh infections were reported in the state within 24 hours while in Bhubaneswar 171 new cases were reported in a day, highest this year.
